sub_topic: Finding the area of a sector of a circle.
message_1: What is the area of a sector of a circle having a radius of 7 cm and a central angle of 60 degrees?
message_2:
To find the area of a sector of a circle, we can use the formula:

Area of sector = (Central angle / 360°) × π × radius²

Given the radius (r) is 7 cm and the central angle is 60°, we can plug these values into the formula:

Area of sector = (60° / 360°) × π × 7²

Area of sector = (1/6) × π × 49

Area of sector = 49π/6

The area of the sector is (49π/6) square centimeters.
